definition: completely/fully/without omission
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to lay bare/to come to light
be plainly visible
damaged beyond repair
detailed and nothing left out (idiom); meticulous and comprehensive/not missing an iota
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety
exhaustive/thorough

sentences.english: His wild ambition was thoroughly exposed.
sentences.chinese: 他的狼子野心暴露无遗。

sentences.english: I certainly did . The sky was very clear, and we could see for miles and miles.
sentences.chinese: 当然有，天空十分晴朗，我们可以一览无遗。
你的诡计已暴露无遗了。

sentences.english: Do you chat with people in the hallways and reveal your own weaknesses to them?
sentences.chinese: 你会在走廊与人闲聊，还把自己的弱点都暴露无遗吗？

sentences.english: His evil intentions were manifest and yet we could not stop him.
sentences.chinese: 译他的险恶用心表露无遗，但是我们却没办法阻止他。

sentences.english: The clues to solving them are all around, hidden in plain sight.
sentences.chinese: 解谜的线索到处都是，藏在我们能够一览无遗的地方。

sentences.english: JANG Hyuk is basking in happiness and it shows.
sentences.chinese: 张赫正沉浸在幸福中，这一点现在已表露无遗。

sentences.english: Cheng hai ambitions are exposed, millions of heroes list but is a conspiracy.
sentences.chinese: 程海的野心暴露无遗，百万英雄榜不过是一场阴谋。

sentences.english: The learning without effort, the old time before.
sentences.chinese: 古人学问无遗力，少壮工夫老始成。

sentences.english: Lest one touch of this heart convey its grief.
sentences.chinese: 生怕心触及，哀伤现无遗。

sentences.english: Second, write it down, to externalize it.
sentences.chinese: 第二，把它记下来，让它暴露无遗。

sentences.english: We've taken control every time we've had a chance to, but not without regrets.
sentences.chinese: 我们控制了每一个选择，但是也不无遗憾。

sentences.english: And then there is the sheer joy, etched so openly on the musicians' faces.
sentences.chinese: 乐师们脸上有种表露无遗的纯粹快乐。

sentences.english: The scale of the cruelty to which Baby P had been subjected became apparent at the postmortem examination.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿P所遭受的残酷虐待在验尸中显露无遗。

sentences.english: And his determined and competitive spirit was already apparent at that young age.
sentences.chinese: 他的决心和好强在那么小的年纪就已经显露无遗。

definition: to expose/to reveal
to show in full light/to be revealed in its entirety
to become visible/to reveal
to cover all at one glance (idiom)/a panoramic view
be plainly visible
to lay bare/to come to light
to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)
lit. extreme saturation (idiom)/fig. vividly and thoroughly/in great detail/without restraint/(of a performance) brilliant
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
to appear/to come out in the open
in the finest detail
to express/to exhibit
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
to manifest
to come to prominence/to appear clearly/to stick out
